## Jwt.verify() method

Verifies and decodes a JWT token, returning the original payload. Throws an error if the token is expired, invalid, or malformed.

**Signature:**

```typescript
verify(token: string, options?: VerifyOptions): T;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

token


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

The JWT token string to verify


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

options


</td><td>

VerifyOptions


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Additional verification options from jsonwebtoken


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

T

The decoded payload of type T

## Exceptions

{<!-- -->TokenExpiredError<!-- -->} If the token has expired

{<!-- -->JsonWebTokenError<!-- -->} If the token is invalid

{<!-- -->Error<!-- -->} For other verification failures

## Example


```typescript
try {
  const payload = jwt.verify(token);
  console.log(payload.userId); // Type-safe access
} catch (error) {
  if (error instanceof TokenExpiredError) {
    // Handle expired token
  }
}
```
